author: cnbc.com
title: Guidewire Software reports 2Q loss
text:
FOSTER CITY, Calif. (AP) _ Guidewire Software Inc. (GWRE) on Tuesday reported a fiscal second-quarter loss of $45.6 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
The Foster City, California-based company said it had a loss of 59 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for pretax expenses and stock option expense, were 33 cents per share.
The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 19 cents per share.
The provider of software to the insurance industry posted revenue of $163.8 million in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $154.3 million.
For the current quarter ending in May, Guidewire Software said it expects revenue in the range of $135 million to $139 million. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $146.9 million.
The company expects full-year earnings in the range of 98 cents to $1.04 per share, with revenue ranging from $644 million to $650 million.
Guidewire Software shares have increased 15 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $85.23, a climb of 49 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on GWRE at https://www.zacks.com/ap/GWRE
